episodeTitle: Our Bodies Vanish! The Morning Sun Shines on the Nightmarish Island!
episodeTitleJapanese: 肉体が消える！悪夢の島に射す朝日！
episodeTitleRomanized: Karada ga Kieru! Akumu no Shima ni Sasu Asahi!
description: Luffy confronts the colossal Gecko Moria after he absorbs 1,000 shadows through Shadow's Asgard. Using Gear 2 and then combining it with Gear 3, Luffy unleashes his new technique Gigant Jet Shell to defeat Moria. As dawn breaks and shadows are returned, those who were shadowless begin vanishing in the sunlight.

openingSong.title: We Are! (Animation One Piece 10th Anniversary Ver.)

events.title: Moria Activates Shadow's Asgard with 1,000 Shadows
events.description: Gecko Moria absorbs 1,000 shadows from across Thriller Bark into his body using his ultimate technique Shadow's Asgard. His body transforms into a massive, grotesque giant form ten times larger than his normal size, gaining enormous strength.
events.significance: This represents Moria's final trump card and creates a ticking clock as dawn approaches. The technique demonstrates the full potential of the Kage Kage no Mi devil fruit, though the strain of controlling so many shadows proves to be his weakness.

quotes.text: Shadow's Asgard! I'll show you the true power of a Warlord of the Sea!
quotes.speaker: Gecko Moria
quotes.context: Moria absorbs 1,000 shadows to become a giant

events.title: Lola's Courage in the Face of Death
events.description: Captain Lola demonstrates remarkable bravery by staying on the battlefield to support her crew despite having no shadow, knowing that the rising sun will kill her. She refuses to abandon her comrades even in the face of certain death.
events.significance: This moment showcases the One Piece theme of loyalty and camaraderie, with Lola willing to sacrifice herself for her crew. It also emphasizes the desperate time pressure facing all shadowless victims.

quotes.text: I won't run! Not while my crew still needs me!
quotes.speaker: Lola
quotes.context: Lola refuses to flee despite the approaching dawn

events.title: Luffy Engages Giant Moria in Gear 2
events.description: Luffy activates Gear 2 and begins his assault on the enlarged Moria, launching a series of high-speed attacks including Jet Rocket and Jet Bazooka. While the attacks land, the sheer size and power of Moria's Shadow's Asgard form makes him difficult to damage.
events.significance: This shows Luffy recognizing the urgency of the situation and immediately using his strongest form. The initial ineffectiveness of Gear 2 sets up the need for an even more powerful technique.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy activates Gear 2 to fight the giant Moria

events.title: Moria Uses Jet Bazooka to Release Hundreds of Shadows
events.description: Luffy's rapid Jet Bazooka barrage strikes Moria repeatedly, causing the strain of controlling so many shadows to show. Hundreds of shadows begin escaping from Moria's body with each hit, weakening him gradually.
events.significance: This reveals the critical weakness of Shadow's Asgard - while it grants immense power, the user struggles to maintain control of so many shadows, especially when taking damage. It gives Luffy a viable strategy to defeat the giant.

events.title: Moria Traps Luffy in Black Box
events.description: Moria counterattacks by using his shadow manipulation to create Brick Bats that form a Black Box prison around Luffy. The shadow construct crushes down on Luffy with immense force as Moria stomps on it repeatedly.
events.significance: This demonstrates another application of Moria's devil fruit powers and creates a moment of peril for Luffy. However, Luffy's rubber body allows him to survive and bounce back from the crushing attack.

quotes.text: Black Box! Now you're trapped, Straw Hat!
quotes.speaker: Gecko Moria
quotes.context: Moria traps Luffy in a shadow prison

events.title: Luffy Escapes Black Box Due to Rubber Body
events.description: Despite being crushed repeatedly in the Black Box, Luffy's rubber physiology allows him to bounce back unharmed. He breaks free from the shadow prison, demonstrating the advantage of his devil fruit's properties.
events.significance: This showcases a fundamental strength of the Gomu Gomu no Mi - Luffy's rubber body is resistant to blunt force and crushing attacks, making certain enemy techniques ineffective against him.

events.title: Luffy Combines Gear 2 and Gear 3 for the First Time
events.description: In a desperate move, Luffy simultaneously activates both Gear 2 and Gear 3 by inflating his torso with air while maintaining his enhanced blood flow. This unprecedented combination creates a massive, high-speed projectile attack that surprises both his crew and Moria.
events.significance: This is the first time Luffy has ever combined two Gear forms, representing a major evolution in his fighting technique. The combination is extremely dangerous as it compounds the strain on his body from both forms, but creates devastating power.

quotes.text: What?! He's using both Gears at once?!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: The crew reacts in shock to Luffy's technique

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Gigant Jet Shell Debuts
events.description: Luffy launches his ultimate pre-timeskip technique - Gomu Gomu no Gigant Jet Shell. With his enlarged torso moving at Gear 2 speeds, he transforms himself into a massive, high-velocity projectile that crashes into Moria with devastating force, knocking him under the collapsing mast of Thriller Bark.
events.significance: This technique represents Luffy's strongest attack before the timeskip and demonstrates his ability to innovate in battle by combining his techniques. The move proves powerful enough to defeat a Warlord of the Sea who had absorbed 1,000 shadows, establishing it as a finishing move.

quotes.text: Gomu Gomu no... Gigant Jet Shell!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy unleashes his new ultimate technique

events.title: Moria Defeated, All Shadows Released
events.description: The Gigant Jet Shell's impact forces Moria to lose control of all 1,000 shadows he had absorbed. The shadows stream out of his body and fly back to their original owners across Thriller Bark and beyond, restoring everyone's ability to survive in sunlight.
events.significance: This marks the climactic victory over Gecko Moria and resolves the main conflict of the Thriller Bark arc. The return of the shadows saves countless lives as dawn is breaking, creating a race against time.

quotes.text: You may have won this time, Straw Hat... but the New World will destroy you...
quotes.speaker: Gecko Moria

events.title: Moria's New World Warning
events.description: In defeat, Moria warns Luffy about the dangers of the New World, hinting that greater challenges and more powerful enemies await. He speaks from personal experience, having lost his entire crew in the New World.
events.significance: This foreshadows the second half of One Piece and plants seeds for future arcs. Moria's warning carries weight as he is a Warlord who experienced the New World's dangers firsthand, suggesting Luffy's current strength may not be sufficient.

quotes.text: The New World... you're not ready for what awaits there...
quotes.speaker: Gecko Moria
quotes.context: Moria warns Luffy about the New World

events.title: Dawn Arrives on Thriller Bark
events.description: The sun rises over Thriller Bark, its light beginning to pierce through the fog surrounding the island. Those whose shadows were stolen celebrate their return, but the episode reveals it's not over yet as some complications remain.
events.significance: The arrival of dawn creates a bittersweet moment - while the shadows have been returned, it also reveals the narrow margin of victory. This emphasizes the life-or-death stakes of the entire arc.

events.title: Shadowless Victims Begin Vanishing
events.description: As the episode ends, the building collapses and exposes the Straw Hats to direct sunlight. Luffy, Zoro, Robin, and Sanji - whose shadows were still returning - begin to burn and fade, their bodies starting to vanish in the sunlight in a dramatic cliffhanger.
events.significance: This creates a dramatic cliffhanger ending and emphasizes the supernatural rules established by the Kage Kage no Mi. Even though Moria was defeated, the consequences of having one's shadow stolen create lingering danger.

quotes.text: Shadow's Asgard! I'll show you the true power of a Warlord of the Sea!
quotes.speaker: Gecko Moria

quotes.text: I won't run! Not while my crew still needs me!
quotes.speaker: Lola
quotes.context: Lola refuses to flee despite the approaching dawn

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy activates Gear 2 to fight giant Moria

quotes.text: What?! He's using both Gears at once?!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: The crew reacts to Luffy combining Gear 2 and Gear 3

quotes.text: Gomu Gomu no... Gigant Jet Shell!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy unleashes his ultimate technique against Moria

quotes.text: You may have won this time, Straw Hat... but the New World will destroy you...
quotes.speaker: Gecko Moria

themes.description: Luffy demonstrates the ability to evolve his fighting techniques in the heat of battle by combining Gear 2 and Gear 3 for the first time, showing that true strength comes from adapting to challenges.
themes.symbolism: The combination of two Gears represents Luffy's growth and willingness to push beyond established limits, even at great personal risk.

themes.description: Lola's willingness to face death alongside her crew exemplifies the One Piece theme of loyalty and camaraderie, showing that true bonds transcend self-preservation.
themes.symbolism: The rising sun represents both salvation and danger, creating a dual symbolism of hope and mortality.

themes.description: Moria's Shadow's Asgard demonstrates that raw power without control is ultimately self-defeating. His inability to maintain control of 1,000 shadows becomes his downfall.
themes.symbolism: Moria's grotesque transformation represents the corrupting nature of power pursued without wisdom or restraint.

themes.description: The approaching dawn creates a ticking clock that drives the narrative tension, emphasizing that sometimes victory must be achieved within strict time constraints.
themes.symbolism: Dawn typically symbolizes hope and new beginnings, but here it represents imminent death for the shadowless, inverting the typical symbolism.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates strategic thinking and innovation by combining his Gear forms for the first time, showing growth beyond just physical strength. He recognizes the urgency of the situation and takes extreme risks to save everyone.
keyActions: Activates Gear 2 to fight giant Moria
Survives being crushed in the Black Box
Innovates by combining Gear 2 and Gear 3 simultaneously
Defeats Moria with Gomu Gomu no Gigant Jet Shell
quotes: Gomu Gomu no... Gigant Jet Shell!

characterSpotlights.development: Moria reveals the full extent of his devil fruit powers but also shows the limitations of relying purely on external strength. His defeat and warning about the New World add depth to his character beyond being a simple villain.
keyActions: Loses control of shadows and is defeated
Warns Luffy about the dangers of the New World
quotes: Shadow's Asgard! I'll show you the true power of a Warlord of the Sea!
You may have won this time, Straw Hat... but the New World will destroy you...

characterSpotlights.development: Lola demonstrates extraordinary bravery and loyalty by refusing to flee despite facing certain death from the sunrise. Her courage inspires others and exemplifies the bonds between pirates who respect each other.
keyActions: Stays on the battlefield despite being shadowless
Supports her crew as dawn approaches
Witnesses the return of the shadows
quotes: I won't run! Not while my crew still needs me!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the fight scenes between Luffy and Moria with additional Jet Bazooka attacks and reactions from the Straw Hat crew that were not shown in as much detail in the manga.
The anime added more dramatic visual effects to the Shadow's Asgard transformation and the release of the 1,000 shadows, with enhanced lighting and shadow particles.
Additional reaction shots from Lola and other shadowless victims were added to emphasize the time pressure of the approaching dawn.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first and only time in the pre-timeskip era that Luffy simultaneously combines Gear 2 and Gear 3. He would not use this combination again until after the two-year timeskip.

sources.title: Gomu Gomu no Mi/Gear 3 Techniques - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The Gigant Jet Shell technique caused such strain on Luffy's body that he passed out immediately after using it, demonstrating the extreme physical cost of combining two Gear forms.

sources.title: Luffy's Best Gear 3 Moments in One Piece, Ranked - CBR

trivia.fact: Moria absorbed 1,000 shadows for Shadow's Asgard, which is 10 times more than the 100 shadows Luffy absorbed to become Nightmare Luffy in episode 372.

sources.title: Kage Kage no Mi - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: This episode adapted content from chapters 481-482 of the manga, covering the climax of the Luffy vs Moria battle.
The opening theme 'We Are! (Animation One Piece 10th Anniversary Ver.)' performed by TVXQ was a special remake of the original opening to celebrate One Piece's 10th anniversary.

sources.title: Share the World / We Are! - Wikipedia

trivia.fact: According to episode reviews, the animation quality in this episode showed improvement over earlier One Piece episodes, particularly in the depiction of the shadows being released and the characters beginning to vanish.
A Dragon Ball Z reference appears in the background animation of this episode, and Pandaman makes a cameo appearance.
